ygData.subject: Re: On Selos Consonant Chain and Largo's Melodic Binding
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, it definitely overwrites snare. ... This has changed so often I don t even try to figure out how it works anymore.  When did you test this?  I tried
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 28 Dec 1999 Valharick@... wrote:
>
> I havent set out and actually done anything to test this, but i know from exp
> that if a ranger/druid snares a mob and I chain it, it moves at regular speed
> when the chain fades.

Yes, it definitely overwrites snare.

> BTW if anyone didnt know this here ya go. If you get rooted chain yourself,
> you'll be able to move at a walk, from there kick selo's in adn you will be
> at selo's speed. Saved me a few times once i found this out.

This has changed so often I don't even try to figure out how
it works anymore. When did you test this? I tried it soon
after Accel stopped breaking root - Chain would break root,
but the root icon would remain. So you wouldn't be rooted
anymore, but Accel would not take hold until the root icon
disappeared. That was over a month ago so it's possible it has
been changed again.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
